meanings.definition: Remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to bowdlerise the book before reading it to the class.
meanings.sent2: The editor decided to bowdlerise the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian had to bowdlerise the children's book by removing the scary parts.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully bowdlerised the movie script to make it family-friendly.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to bowdlerise the painting by covering up the inappropriate content.

meanings.definition: Modify a text by removing or changing content deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: The author had to bowdlerise the novel to comply with the publisher's guidelines.
meanings.sent2: Parents often request schools to bowdlerise textbooks for younger students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would bowdlerise his jokes for the kids' show.
meanings.sent4: The director had to bowdlerise the film to avoid a higher age rating.
meanings.sent5: The journalist had to bowdlerise the article to avoid offending any readers.
